title: Missing skin
body:
I bought a skin last year and Riot support member is claiming I never bought a skin last year because the record shows only last 90 days for purchases.
Obviously there is a problem on Riot's end and its obvious given that they only recently start given out receipts for purchases for Riot points also by email. I checked my email and there was no record keeping last year. I checked the paypal transaction and its still there as proof for purchase of RP. I would not lie and am 100% sure I got the master Yi chosen one skin.

I only have been banned temporarily long ago and if that is the reason for the skin forfeit then that would be **terrible**, then **why **would they remove my skin and continue to let me play? So that I can spend more money again on the same skin? 

If I cannot get back my  master yi skin then I will refund the recent purchases I made and quit the game and gift the rubbish.

replies.body:
The EULA states that once you give them any money, they're entitle to do what they please with their account. It's bull%%%% but it does mean that they aren't breaking the law.

When you make such a purchase then it is your responsibility to keep your receipt. When you make any purchases with money on the League client, there is a receipt screen and transaction number.

Unfortunately I can't refund Riot Points too. Looks like I'm gonna have to gift my remaining RP with a skin or something. What  a truly awful way to end my time with this game, having played about 3000 games. That's about 3000*40 minutes =120000, / 60 minutes = 2000 hours played. Mindblowing. In my time playing this game several champions I have already unlocked have been locked, forcing me to unlock again.(No it was not free week champ)

Now my master yi skin is **gone **and very unhappy about it. I will **no **longer support a company that tries to enforce illegal terms. Given that it is a digital good that is non perishable and a recent purchase, and not being to use said product, it is violating Australian Consumer Law.
if you are gifting %%%% send me one please. other than that, I'm pretty surprised they don't keep longer records
